    This note will always be updated.

    Online tools #

    1. AutoDraw -- an drawing platform using AI to guess what you draw. Try it!

    Images #

    1. Compress images: PNG, JPG.
    2. Remove background / Transparent photos: online png tools, lunapic.
    3. iloveimg: resize, crop, compress, rotate.
    4. Side by side images: this tool.
    5. Change color:
      • of a single color: onlinepngtools
      • all colors to a single different one: manytools
    6. Free photos:
      • Icon / Logo: vectorlogo (only marques), flaticon (a lot, be able to custom color)
      • Stocks: unsplash & pexels & pixabay (taken by photographers), freepik (with vector sources).
    7. Get link Google Photos
    8. Add border to png -> onlinephototools
    9. Convert to SVG

    Office #

    1. PDF tools:
      • Convert PDF to Word (conserve format): freepdfconverter.
      • PDF Editor online free: pdfescape
        • Edit text: sejda
        • Change metadata: bluepdf
        • View pdf's metadata: pdfyeah
    2. Etherpad -- a highly customizable Open Source online editor providing collaborative editing in really real-time.
    3. Text recognition (OCR): newocr
    4. LaTeX tools
      • Overleaf -- online LaTeX editor.
      • IguanaTex -- A Free LaTeX Add-In for PowerPoint on Windows
    5. Obsidian -- Obsidian is a powerful knowledge base that works on top of
      a local folder of plain text Markdown files.

    Multi-platforms #

    1. GitKraken -- git client for ubuntu (better than Github Desktop when importing local)
    2. GoldenDict -- dictionaries + its dictionaries.
    3. Google Play Music Desktop Player (support Youtube Music with custom controllers, online only).
    4. Jitsi Meet -- More secure, more flexible, and completely free video conferencing.
    5. Mailspring -- Email client.
    6. Typora -- WYSWYG markdown editor.
    7. VirtualBox -- virtual machine.
    8. XDM -- download manager.
    9. Download Youtube playlist
    10. ShareDrop -- P2P file transfer.

    Windows #

    1. Big Stretch Reminder -- free simple reminder tool that prompts a user to take regular breaks and helps prevent the symptoms of Repetitive Strain Injury (RSI).
    2. cmder (Console Emulator) -- (update 11/20: should use Windows Terminal with dropdown support) drop-down terminal for windows. My setting file.
    3. DeepL -- Quickly translate app (by using Ctrl + C + C).
    4. Everything -- an alternative to Spotlight in Mac. You can search any thing (app, docs, files,...) in your computer with hotkeys.
    5. FastStone Capture -- screen recorder.
    6. Lingoes -- dictionary (used alongside with GoldenDict) -- its dictionaries.
    7. LockHunter -- find what application/process is preventing us from deleting some folder/file.
    8. ScreenToGif -- screen recorder and auto convert to gif file.
    9. Unikey -- Vietnamese input method on Windows.

    Linux #

    1. Cheese (Appstore) -- webcam for linux.
    2. Foliate (Appstore) -- Book reader.
    3. gThumb (Appstore) -- photo viewer + quick editing tools.
    4. Guake Terminal -- drop-down terminal (more settings)
    5. Kazam (Appstore) -- Screen Recorder.
    6. Lotion -- Unofficial Notion client for linux (online only)
    7. Lutris -- playing games on linux.
    8. Notejot (Appstore) -- sticky note.
    9. OpenComic -- read offline comic with many supported files (zip, folder containing images,...)
    10. Rhythmbox (Appstore) -- Music player on Linux (custom hotkeys).
    11. Workrave -- a program that assists in the recovery and prevention of Repetitive Strain Injury (RSI).
    12. exfalso (Appstore) -- edit mp3 tag on linux.

    MacOS #

    1. iTerm2 -- drop-down terminal.
    2. Time Out -- a program that assists in the recovery and prevention of Repetitive Strain Injury (RSI).

    Education #

    1. Foreign language learning:
      • DeepL -- "better than google translate" app for Windows. You can use Ctrl + C + C to quickly translate a word or phrase.
      • GoldenDict -- global dictionary (multi-platform). Its dictionaries.
      • Lingoes -- Global dictionary for Windows. Its dictionaries.
      • QTranslate -- quickly translate any word / phrase and also their pronunciation by using hotkeys (for example, you can use Ctrl + E to hear the pronunciation and Ctrl + Q to see the translation). The data is obtained from various sources including deepl and google translate.
      • LyricsTraining -- a new way to learn English and other languages through music and the lyrics of your favourite songs.
      • PhimLearning -- watch movie and learning foreign language with bilanguage-subtitles.
      • Grammar & Spell check online: Scriben, Grammarly, 1checker.
    2. Raindrop -- bookmark to read later the articles (like Pocket)
    3. arXiv Vanity -- renders academic papers from arXiv as responsive web pages so you donâ€™t have to squint at a PDF.
    4. b-ok -- download books (may be illigal).

    Math tools #

    1. Matcha -- draw / write LaTeX / Tikz online, very beautiful.
    2. WolframAlpha -- powerfully computational intelligence.
    3. Geogebra Graphhing Calculator -- draw graph online with Geogebra.
    4. Desmos -- advanced Graphing calculator.
    5. Sketchometry
    6. Diagram

    Chrome extension #

    1. Adblock Plus - free ad blocker
    2. AutoTube -- YouTube nonstop (for ones who wanna listen to a video music which has more than 1 hour length)
    3. AVIM -- Vietnamese input method
    4. Copy URL with title -- copy title and URL using Ctrl + C (Win/Linux) / âŒ¥ Option + C (Mac). Use Alt + C (Win/Linux) / âŒ¥ Option + C (Mac) to get them in markdown link format.
    5. Google Dictionary (by Google)
    6. Hush -- private bookmarking
    7. LastPass -- Free Password Manager
    8. Mate -- Quick translater.
    9. Microsoft Editor -- Spelling & Grammar Checker
    10. Picture-in-Picture Extension (by Google) -- Picture-in-Picture (PiP) allows you to watch videos in a floating window (always on top of other windows) so you can keep an eye on what youâ€™re watching while interacting with other sites, or applications.
    11. Print Friendly & PDF -- print any web page into pdf.
    12. Raindrop.io -- All-in-one bookmark manager (better than Pocket)
    13. TabCloud -- save current tab list

    Data Science / Machine Learning #

    1. Graphviz export
      • Download Graphviz here.
      • Its online version.
    2. Vaex -- Handle huge dataframe.
    3. Replicate -- Version control for machine learning.
    4. Observable -- Explore and visualize data with advanced notebooks.
    5. nbdev -- Create delightful python projects using Jupyter Notebooks.
    6. Mapbox -- Maps and location for developers.
    7. Foursquare -- Put the most trusted, independent location data and technology platform to work for your business.
    8. idyll -- A toolkit for creating data-driven stories and explorable explanations.
    9. Chart.js | Open source HTML5 Charts for your website

    Web Dev #

    Tools for Web Dev #

    1. HTML characters: copy & paste HTML characters.
    2. google-webfonts-helper -- A Hassle-Free Way to Self-Host Google Fonts -- giving us font files and font-face declarations based on the fonts, charsets, styles, and browser support you select.
    3. Regular Expression 101 -- rules and transform directly.
    4. Free fonts for WEB and Photoshop â€” BestFonts.pro -- may be illegal.
    5. Webfont Generator
    6. appium -- Automation for Apps (used to testing UX on different devices, more exact than Browser Inspector)
    7. Fontello -- make an icon as a font (there are also Awesomefont).
    8. Wayback mahine -- an internet archive (to check old/dead websites).
    9. Happy Hues - Curated colors in context. -- Not sure what colors to use in your designs or where to use them? Happy Hues is a color palette inspiration site that acts as a real world example as to how the colors could be used in your design projects.
    10. JavaScript Event KeyCodes -- get the keycode of any key when you press.
    11. Facebook Sharing Debugger tool -- check if your urls display correctly or not on facebook.
    12. Tiny helpers (github) -- A collection of free single-purpose online tools for web developers.

    Frameworks #

    1. Matter.js -- a 2D physics engine for the web.
    2. Stage.js -- 2D JavaScript library for cross-platform HTML5 game development.
    3. Text & Editor:
      1. Quill -- Your powerful rich text editor.
      2. markdown-it -- Markdown parser, done right. 100% CommonMark support, extensions, syntax plugins & high speed
    4. For drawing / illustrating:
      1. Chart.js -- Open source HTML5 Charts for your website.
      2. Two.js -- a two-dimensional drawing api geared towards modern web browsers. It is renderer agnostic enabling the same api to draw in multiple contexts: svg, canvas, and webgl.
      3. Three.js â€“ JavaScript 3D library
      4. Rough.js
      5. JSXGraph -- JSXGraph is a cross-browser JavaScript library for interactive geometry, function plotting, charting, and data visualization in the web browser.
      6. Vector.js -- Vector is an open source javascript library for creating interactive graphics.
    5. For visualizing data:
      1. Plotly -- JavaScript Open Source Graphing Library
      2. D3.js -- a JavaScript library for manipulating documents based on data.
      3. idyll -- A toolkit for creating data-driven stories and explorable explanations.

    Illustration tools #

    1. Microsoft Office Powerpoint (paid, Windows), OnlyOffice Presentation (free, multiplatform), Google Drawing (free, online) -- quickly illustate ideas.
      • Make featured image for posts.
      • Draw simple geometrical shapes / graph / flow charts or even mathematical function graphs.
      • Make charts to illustrate data points (have a link to MS Excel or OnlyOffice SpreadSheet).
      • Support inserting math equations.
      • Save figure by capturing screen, .png format.
    2. Desmos -- make interative graphs / charts.
      • Exact function graph with formulas from input (desmos/calculator)
      • Interative graphs (examples)
      • Basic geometrical shapes (desmos/geometry)
      • Save figure under .png files or embed desmos code in your website.
    3. Matcha -- Draw beautiful figures/graphs like LaTeX.
    4. JSXGraph -- Make interactive graph inside posts.

    Others #

    1. talentoday -- Empowering Growth for Individuals and Teams
